title.narrative: FAIR4ALL Regional Value Chains in Asia

description.narrative: The Power of Voices Partnership (PvP) is an influencing programme with the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The programme FAIR for ALL led by Oxfam Novib is five year long initiative implemented jointly with consortium members Huairou Commission, SOMO and Third World Network-Africa (TWN-Africa) aimed at supporting and collaborating with people’s rightful demands towards companies, governments and multilateral organizations for economic, social and environmental justice, promoting global trade and value-chains that are fair for all. The main focus of the FAIR for ALL programme proposal is to support and strengthen CSOs to play their diverse roles; as educators, mobilizers, creators and watchdogs to make trade and value chains FAIR for ALL. In Asia, FAIR for ALL programme aims at a stronger regional movement of CSOs, small producers, workers and women create spaces, mobilize citizens and act together with progressive governments and private sector towards inclusive and sustainable value chains inAsia that respect human rights and the environment, promote women’s economic empowerment. The Asia FAIR for ALL programme will be implemented by Oxfam in Asia and partners, aiming to: 1)Convening and capacity building for a more responsible private andfinancial sector: we work with all five PVP countries in Asia on research and campaigning capacity building and expanding civic space through alliances/networking. 2) Engagement with the ASEAN and member states: we will work with all four ASEAN membersstates who are part of PvP on fiscal governance and ASEAN inclusive business framework; 3) contributing to shifting the terms of debate (PW 1,2,3,4)- this will lead- work with all countries to showcase their alternate business models at regional level. These objectives will be achieved by Convene and support CSOs, workers, women’s rights organizations and producers to raise their collective voices against violations of human rights, women’s right andlabour rights; Capacity strengthening of CSOs in research, public campaigning and advocacy for inclusive and sustainable value chains and against shrinking civic space; promoting fair fiscal governance and progressive spending to ASEAN, its member states, and other South Asian governments. Additionally, through research and alliance building, develop thought leadership on alternative, inclusive business models, and raising awareness of and engage with the Asian public and sensitize the media to create a public constituency asking for inclusive and sustainable value chains and strong government regulations to protect human rights and the environment. To achieve main objectives of the programme in Asia, Oxfam will collaborate with Tax and Fiscal Justice Network Asia (TAFJA); SAAPE; Convening a bottom up built agribusiness network-To convene a network of agriculture workers, small producers, women rights organization and other workers affected by unfair practices of value chains led by women rights organization to articulate and amplify voices for fair value chains; finally we will work with a research partner.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam International was formed in 1995 by a group of independent non-governmental organizations. Their aim was to work together forgreater impact on the international stage to reduce poverty and injustice. The name "Oxfam" comes from the Oxford Committee for Famine Relief, founded in Britain in 1942. The group campaigned for food supplies to be sent through an allied naval blockade to starving women and children in enemy-occupied Greece during the Second World War. As well as becoming a world leader in the delivery of emergency relief, Oxfam International implements long-term development programs in vulnerable communities. We are also part of a global movement, campaigning with others, for instance, to end unfair trade rules, demand better health and education services for all, and to combat climate change. Today, there are 19 member organizations of the Oxfam International confederation. They are based in: Australia, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Great Britain, Hong Kong, Ireland, India, Italy, Japan, Mexico, The Netherlands, New Zealand, Quebec, South Africa, Spain and the United States. The Oxfam International Secretariat is based in Oxford, UK. The Secretariat runs advocacy offices in Addis Ababa, Brussels, Geneva, New York and Washington DC.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
